title: Error launching client
body:
Can't launch client because:
libssl-1_1.dll
libcrypto-1_1.dll
zlib.dll
not working on Windows 10

replies.body:
Typically any of these dll issues point to some files that weren't properly installed or somehow became corrupted afterward. Should be easy enough to fix up though! Follow the steps in the image below, but definitely hit me back up if this doesn't work!!

https://i.gyazo.com/fbe5976243158ecce7efef172951e219.png
Now the C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\league_client\releases\0.0.0.96\deply\ directory's 3 files don't work. same names as the other one zlib.dll, etc.

Well snap, that's no good. I was hoping the quick and easy method would work but it seems like we'll have to hit this a liiiiiittle bit harder to get things fixed. 

Grab the [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) to run with the options **reinstall and clean uninstall** turned on. Make sure any firewalls are turned off during the installation and patching process **but make sure to turn them back on after it's done**. If that doesn't help, we might need to have the techies look into this a little closer.

i've been having the same issues for a couple of days. it works right after i reinstall it, but when i try to launch LOL the next day some other DLL is making problems and it won't launch.
currently reinstalling again so i can play...
I have the same damn thing dude..
